definition: higher education record/record including Master's or Doctoral degree

sentences.english: Rise to the top wage through on-the-job experience or by earning an advanced degree.
sentences.chinese: 高工資的獲得需要工作經驗和高學歷。

sentences.english: In some states you can even become a substitute teacher even if you only have a limited amount of credits.
sentences.chinese: 在一些國家即使你沒有高學歷，也可以成爲代課老師。

sentences.english: Highly-educated young urban women are a special population group in China.
sentences.chinese: 高學歷都市青年女性是社會的一個特殊羣體。

sentences.english: But without such teachers the nation will be unable to create such a stratum—internally.
sentences.chinese: 但沒有這些教師，該國也就無法自行產生高學歷階層。

sentences.english: Education can be seen the same way. If your purpose is to be highly educated, then you're going to be disappointed.
sentences.chinese: 教育也一樣，如果目標是高學歷，那將使人失望。

sentences.english: The high-degree employee is one of core competences in private enterprises.
sentences.chinese: 高學歷員工是民營企業核心競爭力之一。

definition: lit. to see only the other rider's dust and have no hope of catching up (idiom)/to be far inferior
to have perfect mastery of sth/to be up to the mark
to be employed/to be in post/on-the-job
to run neck and neck/to keep pace with/to keep abreast of/on a par with one another
independent and autonomous (idiom); self-determination/to act independently/to maintain control over one's own affairs
every trade/all professions/all walks of life
